Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BPisReady
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel 2 blocks away from the Tuileries metro station and 1 block off the rue di Rivoli so a short walk to the Seine, the Louvre, Tuileries Gardens, Place Vendome, Palais Granier, shops, restaurants, etc. The hotel is very clean, all of the staff I interacted with spoke English and were very helpful. The breakfast is good - hot foods and cold. The single room I had was on the small side but every moderately priced hotel is Paris is on the small side; was a quiet room. The deluxe rooms are bigger but I did not see the inside of one. There's a good Irish pub right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: lauriebeth1121
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect for us - a 15 minute walk from the train station but only a 5 minute walk to the subway system. We could walk to most the the attractions in 15 to 20 minutes! The room was very comfortable. Convenient pub located on the same block. The location and quality of the room made up for the fact that it cost more per night than any other place we stayed in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Coe
Reviews.Content: Myself and seven friends all stayed at the Duminy Vendome from St Patricks night 17th March until the 21st. Our stay was really great, as a group of 8 male photographers we all had twin beds and the rooms were very good, they were kept clean and were in very good order. The hotel staff were excellent and very friendly and luckily for us spoke good English. The hotel is in an excellent location and we took the train from the airport and did one change and got off at Tuiliers Metro station and the hotel is a 4 minute walk away. The breakfast was really great with plenty of choice including Sausages and Scrambled Eggs, Fresh fruit, Cereals, Yogurt and plenty of bread etc. We ate very well and meant we only needed a light snack to keep us going until evening time. Great Irish pub next door, handy for our much needed pints of Guinness. (we are all from Ireland!!) Very central to all of Paris and if your taste runs to expensive designer wear then it is just round the corner. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBlyth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - Adrien was really welcoming and helpful with our queries. Room was perfectly comfortable with all appropriate ameneties (great shower). Breakfast was a pleasure and catered for all European tastes.Location was perfect as a base for exploring all the wonderful things that Paris has to offer - Jardin de Tuilieres is only a 2 minute walk!! All the staff were helpul, whether it was ordering a taxi to a venue or bus to the airport. Would certainly stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location. Couldn't fault anything about our stay in this hotel. Room was very comfortable, spacious and clean. Great choice of foods available for breakfast. Perfect for walking to many tourist attractions as well as the metro lines and other restaurants/ cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: chaos1785
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Duminy-Vendome from Jan 28-Feb 5, 2012, for a business trip. Upon arriving at the hotel around 7am, my room was not yet ready but they allowed me to check-in and keep my bags for me. Since I was with a colleague and her room was ready already, I kept my bags in her room instead. I stayed on the 1st floor -- 2nd floor to Americans -- in a Single Room. My colleague had the same Single Room on the 5th floor. Though small, which is typical of hotel rooms in Paris, my room was very comfortable. I think because my room was on the first floor, I had higher ceilings and did not feel claustrophobic at all. Much different from my colleague's room, she said that she felt claustrophobic and had to open the windows at night. The room was very clean and bed very comfortable. Included in the room were a safe, a closet big enough to fit my clothes for a week, a desk, complimentary coffee and tea, and an AC unit for heating in the winter and airconditioning in the summer. The bathroom was very clean too, which is something I'm very particular about. Amenities included: shampoo, conditioner, soap, shower cap, etc. Towels were always clean as well! Shower was nice and strong and had lots of hot water! Breakfast is located in the basement. Choices range from boiled or scrambled eggs, different cheeses, a variety of meats and sausages, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, croissants, bread, juices. I'm absolutely in love with pain au chocolat so I had that every morning! The cheeses were really good as well! Not much of a coffee drinker so my complimentary instant coffee in the room was fine for me. Was told though if you order decaf coffee in the breakfast area, you get instant but regular coffee is brewed. All the staff at Duminy-Vendome are very friendly and always wear a smile on their faces! They are also willing to help you in any way they can! The lobby always smells good too! Even from outside you can smell hints of lavender! I don't know how they do that but it's so pleasant! The location is also great! It's right in the center of Paris and walking distance to the Louvre, Place Vendome, Tuileries Gardens, Place de la Concorde, Roue de Paris, Faubourg... I love to walk so even in the winter I'd walk to Champs-Elysees, Galleries Lafayette, Opera, Madeleine... It is very convenient! Lots of cafes and restaurants in the area, a convenience store about 2 blocks away in case you want to buy water, shampoo, etc. The Tuileries Metro is also around the corner! The street is very quiet as well, which was really nice after a long day at work and all you want to do is sleep in peace. Only downside is the really tiny elevator. But not uncommon in Paris so no biggie there! As I said, I was on the 1st floor so I always took the stairs. If you have a lot of luggage though, it'll be a hassle to take them upstairs one by one. More than 2 people in the elevator is too tight for me already! Overall, I truly enjoyed my stay at Duminy-Vendome and I highly recommend it! It's not exactly the place if you're on a budget though... I think it was around Euro167 for my Single Room. But it was definitely worth it! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A good base in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: RuswarpBoy
Reviews.Content: A super location for both walking the City and Metro is just over the Rue de Rivoli (250m). Staff excellent with just the right amount of friendliness and professionalism. OK, the bedrooms are small but perfectly adequate, very clean, all the right facilities and good free Wi-Fi. The breakfast room is very relaxing with a good buffet. A few more hot choices would be welcome. Staff at breakfast are again excellent. Absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a good base in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent place”
Reviews.Author: ElijaYJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is OK. The location is really great! The place was quiet. We had a standard double room, size was ok and the only problem was you could easily hear your neighbors. Breakfast was great, as previous traveler said. Staff is great, very helpful. The weather was cold but air condition holds 24 degrees without problem and noise. Will return there.

Reviews.Title: “How Could We have missed it Before”
Reviews.Author: littlejohn46
Reviews.Content: We travel to Paris every February and this was our 12th year. We have stayed in 4 star hotels which did not match up to the Duminy. We do not want a bar or a gym but a Friendly hotel where the Guest is welcome. At the Duminy we found more than we could have expected a wonderful large room albeit a privileged room,fantastic bathroom with twin sinks . Gillian is a coeliac and was allowed to toast her own breads for breakfast . and with the array of cereals , fruits , eggs pasteries, we were reday for anything the weather might throw at us.but it was fine , the cold had gone , but nonetheless in addition to the room being aircondidtioned ,we had an extra oil radiator heater. We can not thank Sarah and all the staff for their professional attention . People who complain about the elevators in french hotel being small dont understand the history of elevators in these buildings. Get used to them they are part of the character.We had a problem withy our credit card company and the reassurance the staff afforded us helped what could have been a stressful end to a perfect holiday. We will not be looking elsewhere next year but will return for as long as the Duminy will have us. Year after Year. Goodbye Marais and Latin Quater at least for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great breakfast, clean”
Reviews.Author: stefan50
Reviews.Content: The elevator is minuscule and mu room was very compact, but service, cleanliness, location and breakfast were all superb. Great place to stay near the Louvre and Place Vendome without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Best coffee I had in Paris”
Reviews.Author: randomly_chaotic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located right near a metro station, and a short walk from Chatelet Les Halles for transfers to the RER. Not that we used the metro that much, as this hotel is in a great location for accessing most attractions on foot. The hotel is clean and well presented, and the staff friendly and helpful. Ida, on the front desk, was so helpful during our stay I cannot recommend her services highly enough. Breakfast in the cellar was the best continental breakfast I've had; pastries, cereals, fruits, compotes, yoghurts, cured meats, eggs, sausages, juices, all very good. The coffee served at breakfast was the best I had in Paris, and I'd stay here again if only to make sure I get a decent cup of coffee during my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, best you'll get for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Hannah G
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a fantastic location in Paris, right opposite the tuileries and Louvre. Genuinely don't think you'd get a better location for the price. Amazing breakfast (make sure you nick some of the rolls for your lunch!) and very good size room with decent ensuite. Clean hotel, friendly staff. Best hotel i've stayed in in Paris for the value. Would say it's probably just approaching 4*, definitely a pitch above other 3*s anyway (I think we may have somehow ended up with a 'privileged' room though). Tip: make sure you book through the hotel's own website as we realised we were being slightly over-charged through other travel websites.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroF
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel, great location, common parts & breakfast room, shame about my rather old bedroom (402) but at least it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: maureenmmg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and the staff is very good. it is a well priced hotel in a very expensive neighborhood. Great location. Walls are thin...is the biggest drawback. But it is spotless .

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tigerbeth
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Paris , we were glad we chose this hotel , its got a great location , helpful staff . Rooms are on the small side but that is to be expected in Europe. We were able to walk to a lot of attractions ,not far from the Ritz and the exclusive shops of Paris, Loved every minute of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: samanthafi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in January. Our room did not face the road so it was quiet. The room was small but functional, clean, and updated. The beds were VERY comfortable and breakfast was delicious. They served eggs, sausage, various breads, cereals, yogurt, pastries, cheeses, and juice. Its about a 5-10 min walk to the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay, 30-45 min walk to Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. Picturesque neighborhood and around the corner to Angelina's. Excellent service, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Robin B
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms January 2012. Hotel was immaculately clean, breakfast very good and the staff superb. I am handicapped and use a cane to ambulate. The front desk staff went out of their way to make sure I had a comfortable, spacious room that I could easily get around in on the first floor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free breakfast TripAdvisor deal, not such a deal”
Reviews.Author: EasternShoreTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were going to book this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent. When we were ready to make the reservation, the price had increased almost $400 US. I looked into making the reservation on my own and used the link on TripAdvisor for their "free breakfast" offer. It's not free, it's only 2€ less than their regular "room & breakfast" rate. One would be better off with their "special offer - advance purchase" at 181€, not their TripAdvisor free breakfast at 200€. Sounds like a scam to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and dependable.”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Duminy Vendome and we have come to trust the Duminy as a reliable place to stay when in Paris. It is in a great location near the Louvre and not too far to walk to the Champs Elysees and other sights. Whilst the rooms can sometimes be a little small they are very nice and with this hotel it's all about location. We did note in our last stay that out room had paper thin walls ( to the degree that when the guest in the room next door was on the phone we could actually hear what the person on the other end of the phone was saying - and no it wasn't a hands free phone). We haven't had that problem with previous stays so it may well be a unique problem with that particular room. Overall though we will likely be back to stay at the Duminy Vendome when passing through Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Neighbok
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff amazing, rooms small (by Aussie standards) but cute and clean. Decent size bathroom with a bath! Our room also had a cute little balcony overlooking the street (standard room for two). If you stay here, and you should, get the buffet breakfast. It's amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Gen in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Lovely recently refurbished Hotel located within short walking distance to many major attractions. Metro station approx 5 min wak from the hotel Staff are very helpful and spoke very good English. Hotel had a great feel about it. We stayed in a good floor room which was a little on the small side however was very clean and comfortable and it was Paris. We would definatley recomend a stay here and when we return to Paris again this would be high on ouir list of affordable places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: morrisjanita
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this place and after reading reviews on trip advisor I booked this hotel. The location is the best thing about this hotel. You are within a 5 minute walk to the Louvre. Eiffel tower, Champs Elysees can all be reached by walking, though it will take about 30 minutes. Rooms are very small, but clean and comfortable. If you do not like lifts, you would be best to request a room on a lower floor (i think there are 6 levels) as not only are the lifts tiny, but the stairs are steep and spiral with 18 steps between floors. Breakfast is nice with the usual offerings including eggs/bacon. There was some noise though coming from the pub next door. Didn't affect me, but my boys could hear noise till about 3am. For a 3 star establishment, it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: k99js06
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positive things about this hotel (which my husband and I stayed at for four nights, while in Paris for a conference my husband was attending). 1. It was clean. This always goes a long way in my book; if a hotel isn't clean, nothing else about it is even worth considering. the common spaces and our room were clean, the mattress and sheets were clean, etc. 2. The staff were nice and spoke English very well. They were friendly, pleasant, and tried to be helpful. 3. The location is great; you're within walking distance to most of the tourist and shopping highlights of Paris, and the neighborhood is safe, walkable, and central. 4. The breakfast room is neat, and the food is decent. Now, for my criticisms, which lead me to my decision never to stay at this hotel again: 1. Noise - It was, hands down, the loudest hotel I have ever stayed at. If you do stay here, do not stay in rooms ending in "08" (we were in 108, but avoid any "08" room). The room, despite being an upgraded "Premier" room, shares a wall with the stairway service staff use, and with the laundry chute (which had a spring-loaded, wooden door). Any time anyone went up or down the staircase or used the chute on any floor, we heard the reverberations as if they were in our own room. Despite our complaints, the front desk would not change our room or do anything to discourage the staff from using the staircase or the laundry chute during sleeping hours. I am a very heavy sleeper, and this even woke me up time and time again. The windows also need updating; we heard kegs being unloaded onto the street below for the bar across the street in the wee hours of the morning. Not acceptable; we stumbled around Paris with next to no sleep because this place was SO darn loud. 2. Bathroom - The bathroom desperately needs to be updated. The tub still lacks a shower (there was a hose and shower head, but no mounting mechanism, so you had to hold the shower head/hose the whole time, or take a bath). I know showers are less common in Europe than the US, but this is not acceptable for a hotel this expensive. Also, the hair dryer mounted on the wall was welcome, but it was a horribly outdated model that required you to hold down the button the entire time to keep it on. This is a small detail, unless you have long, thick hair like me and need to dry it every morning in the winter. Then it quickly becomes a sore wrist and tangled hair. No fun. Finally, BYO shampoo and conditioner - the hotel issue shampoo turned my hair to straw. 3. The staff made us a restaurant reservation (upon our request via email before our trip), but told us the wrong time. We showed up at the restaurant on our final night in Paris, and the restaurant had a different time than the hotel gave us for the reservation, so we had to forgo eating at the restaurant. Disappointing. 4. Room amenities were so-so. The cable TV has three english stations, and all were news stations. Not a big deal, but certainly only average. The housekeeping staff did not replace the water in our minibar each day, which was annoying. 5. Free wifi was difficult to log into, (because there were also pay options for faster download speeds) and the password changed too often. The staff had to personally deliver the password to your room, which was a bit odd. On the whole, nothing catastrophic, but there are too many other options in central Paris at this price point to justify going to this hotel again. Still catching up from all the lost sleep due to the extreme noisiness...

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and cozy”
Reviews.Author: golden2002
Reviews.Content: It's small, but well located near the Louvre and great shopping. The rooms are small but comfortable. The air conditioning had been turned off for the summer, so we opened our windows at night. Big mistake. Three locals bars were nearby and noise was very loud until wee hours. Then trash pickup every morning at 6:00 am. There are wonderful restaurants within two blocks. Shopping nearby is terrific. Easy to get a taxi. Guest services were excellent. Breakfast downstairs every morning is fantastic. Concierge was terrific also. A very nice boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelo_Sydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent close to 2 weeks in Paris earlier in the year and Duminy Vendome provided the perfect location to travel this splendid city! It is within walking distance (<30mins) to virtually any prime Paris tourist location including Champs Elysees, Musée du Louvre, Eiffel Tower and so on. It was also close to shops including Galleries Lafayette and several easily located places to enjoy a meal. The room was a decent size with clean amenities and large bathroom. The hotel was undergoing renovations which was loud during the day but was ok as we spent the day outdoors, as you would on a trip. Breakfast was included which included cereals, breads and some hot food. Highly recommend and will stay here again on my return to one of my favourite destinations in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Well located & great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Caetas
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in Sep 2011. Rooms are small but well decorated, very clean and with A/C. Location is excellent, just one block from the Jardin des Tuilleries, two from its Métro station and near everything you want to see: Place Vendôme, Musée du Louvre, etc. There´s also the Fashion District in the Faubourg Saint Honoré just one block away and a number of good restaurants within walking distance, which also might help one´s choice for a hotel in the 1er Arrondissement. Service staff was very, very good. As I remarked in another review, I was travelling with my 88 year-old grandmother, and I was pleased to see how well they treated an aged person, never lacking one second of attention and helping her in all possible ways. The hotel also has a very good breakfast buffet in an enjoyable and well decorated ambiance, which brings real value for the rate, which I considered somewhat high, despite the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location , location”
Reviews.Author: GixxerNZ
Reviews.Content: As many have said the rooms are very small compared to the international style hotels, it is a old building in the heart of Paris, you don't expect vast suites. But what is lacking in room size is certainly made up for by the location, walk to anywhere, 4 minutes to the Louvre, Place Vedome and Place de Concorde, 1 minute to Rue de Rivoli. There are many restaurants, bars, bakeries, all within a couple of minutes walk. I like a comfortable hotel, which this is, but at the end of the day I a staying in Paris to visit Paris not to stay in a hotel and this hotel is perfect for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: clairess_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in September 2011. We enjoyed our stay a lot. The location is fantastic, so we didn't have to get up to early to go to places like the Louvre before the crowds. The room was nice, we didn't find it small. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We had to leave very early on our last day, and they made it easy. Breakfasts were good with a lot of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small size, large service”
Reviews.Author: mh999
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfully convenient boutique hotel! So clean, such nice front desk staff! Easy to get to from the metro; wonderful cafes and shops nearby; walking distance to many of the museums and sights; tea kettle and treats in the room were perfect; very comfortable bed and linens (no bedbugs). While we were there some remodeling was going on in the lobby but it was not at all disruptive. Will most certainly book this hotel again because all my dreams indicate that I am going back to Paris! Thanks to the staff--it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but very, very small room.”
Reviews.Author: IndianaAnn
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff was fabulous...giving us directions and suggestions. Location is fabulous. We walked almost everywhere. Louvre is walking distance. Also walked to Seine. Elevators tiny as well. We knew going to Europe to expect smaller rooms, however, this was the smallest (by far!) of any room we had in all of Europe. When I checked the map of rooms (on door), it appeared we were staying in the smallest on the floor. The room was very nice and the view was great - we looked out on the narrow street with other lovely hotels, many of them with the flower boxes in windows. Just what we had expected/hoped for. Bathroom was very nice. Breakfast was a neat experience in the lower level. food sufficient. Comparable to Holiday Express. We loved location, would definitely stay here again...if we knew we would be in larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of three couples that stayed here in August 2011. It was a convenient, quaint and spotless place to stay. The breakfast included was superb. A fautless stay and highly recommended to others. Well done. Liz M

Reviews.Title: “Central but small”
Reviews.Author: TyronS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our most recent summer vacation. And first of i would like to say that you cannot get more central then this hotel. Its close to most of Paris's attractions. The staff where very helpful and friendly and the hotel was clean, nicely decorated and all over good experience. However the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cnieri
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, the room had a large bed and was clean, not a lot of walking space around the bed, but the bathroom was very spacious and also clean. A nice breakfast was offered with the room rate, one small issue was that the elevator is tiny and could barely accommodate two normal sized adults, we actually had to make multiple trips to get our bags upstairs. Staff was friendly, English speaking, and helpful. The hotel bar is very pretty, and often was empty. Overall a nice stay at this hotel, we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price - will be back”
Reviews.Author: BSanders_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and close to everything. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the buffet breakfast was great! Everything was very fresh. The room was clean, large and quiet. We could not ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...........can not fault this one.”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not be faulted . out of all the hotels we stayed in during our world trip this hotel excelled in all areas. would love to go back and if in Paris we will. Fantastic location and service. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “We had two rooms for 4 of us. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kd1315
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: MartsAndMarts
Reviews.Content: Researching hotels in Paris is a daunting prospect given the sheer number of them. I have stayed in various Paris hotels over the years and had mixed experiences so know it is worth taking the time to do some research. Paris hotels never quite seem to match their rates to their quality, but perhaps this is true of any much visited capital city. However, this hotel is pretty close. Rooms are fairly basic and our room wasn't decorated as funkily as some of the pictures, but they are clean and comfortable and you are not compromising on room standard for a central location, which is often the trade off. The location is excellent, 2 minutes from Tuileries metro station and just off the Rue du Rivoli, yet tucked away down a backstreet. We arrived late, around midnight, and were checked in and welcomed very efficiently. We were also asked if everything was OK with our stay on check out, which was a nice touch which you don't always get (some hotels seem unaware that dissatisfied customers will just tell TripAdvisor instead!) Breakfast is served in a stylish cellar room (you can see it on the pictures) - excellent buffet choice. The waitress forgot our drinks order on the second day (which was irritating as we were keen to get out and about) but this is a minor complaint in what was overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kangarian
Reviews.Content: Great location for the places we wanted to visit most, namely The Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. Walkable distance to Notre Dame. Catch bus #95 from the Louvre to Monmarte. Very convenient to tourist shops on Rue Rivoli and other shops on St Honore all the way down to Les Halles. Restaurants, bars, grocery shops nearby. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Our bathrooms could do with an upgrade though. The lifts are small. Great breakfast with good selections; good coffee and fresh juices; delicious pastries. Courteous and efficient wait staff. You have to get a free voucher, if wanted, for wifi connection every 24 hours. Would certainly stay at this hotel on future visits and recommend this establishment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: tappz
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at a couple of establishments during our time in Paris. Unfortunately Duminy Vendome (DV) wasn't my favourite. To summarise - it was nice enough but given the rate we paid I know we could have done better. The other establishments we stayed at were a similar rate, however, the properties were far nicer and a feeling of 4-5 star versus the 3 star of Duminy. *Location: The location of DV was great in terms of accessing the major attractions e.g. Notre Dame and Louvre and the famed shopping of Champs Alysee. These were all 5 or so minutes stroll (depending on the density of tourists - this could extend to 10 mins if the hordes were out) so it was quite relieving to know at the end of a day of miles of walking you only had a few minutes stroll back to the Hotel. Additionally, cafes and shopping were all around. The cafes located along the main-street nearby were mostly frequented by tourists. Husband and I preferred to venture the back/side streets to cafes which were mostly smaller but had more of a 'local' feel. *Hotel property: The DV is located in an older building, however, despite the age of the property I felt DV lacked style and flair exuding a bland atmosphere. Our rooms were very clean as was the remainder of the Hotel i.e. foyer, passage-ways and breakfast room, however, there was were constant reminders of the hotel's age. I don't usually scan for tell-tale signs, however, you couldn't miss old skirtings, peeling wall-paper and musty smell/feeling in the rooms and hallway. Renovations are currently taking place and looks to be a big project. I wouldn't stay again for this reason alone. Although cleanliness is a priority (which was definitely met) I prefer an establishment that reflects taste and smartness versus tired and old. *Hotel staff: I had read some very favourable reviews about the DV staff and this was re-inforced with the friendly and prompt email I received from Lauren, prior to our visit. On arrival we promptly sought to up-grade our room for space reasons. This request was very promptly accommodated and we were more than happy with the spacious 'privilege' room. Generally the staff were pleasant and obligingly offered help if it was sought. However, it was disappointing to note reception staff frequently huddled and exuded an air of aloofness. I am used to staff offering up at least an acknowledgement or friendly hello when in the presence of guests, without being intrusive. In the case of DV I felt staff were aloof and didn't engage with guests unless they had to. I also thought it somewhat unprofessional to see 3 staff smoking immediately outside the establishment in what must have been a tea/smoko break. I would have thought there was a delegated area for such breaks without the invasion of guests peering on - I guess space is at a premium. *Breakfast: Nice enough. Once again I am not being overly fussy, I guess it was natural that I compared with other properties we stayed at during our Paris stay. I usually love breaking out while on holiday including pastry-ing every morning. In this instance I didn't bother much with the croissants or other pastries. They weren't any different to our super-market baked variety back home. The staff were pleasant and quickly accommodated our requests. Conclusively, although the location hit the mark, the property (including staff) showed a complete absence of style and flair. On this basis I wouldn't stay again - we paid 200 euro per night for a room privelege (king-size bed spacious but tired).

Reviews.Title: “We like it”
Reviews.Author: Célia S
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel in May 2011. It is very close to the subway, has good prices, free wi fi, good service and breakfast fancy. We recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Typically French, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Karen-Phil
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great location. Staff were very helpful, room was small but clean and comfortable. 5 minute walk to Tulleries metro station, walking distance to Notre Dame and The Louvre. Breakfast was in what I think was an old cellar , it was a great room and breakfast was also great. Irish Pub next door which was handy for a cold beer after a long day of sight seeing.Highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DinaS61
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and we could not have stayed in a better place. The location was central yet it was in a quiet street and the staff were very helpful. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a neat little hotel”
Reviews.Author: suez
Reviews.Content: Position of this hotel is amazing walking distance to louvre, champs elysees central city as well as lots of cafes and restaurants - the staff are extremely helpful too

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mbudensiek
Reviews.Content: We returned from our first trip to Paris after spending eight days at the Duminy Vendome and could not have been happier with our choice. Tucked away a block off of busy (and touristy) Rue de Rivoli, the hotel was across the street from a convenient Metro stop (Tuilleries--Line 1) and within easy walking distance to the Louvre, Palais Royale, Musee D'Orsay, Musee Orangerie, Place Concorde and Place Vendome. The property itself was very pleasant--clean, modern, air-conditioned and comfortable rooms showing evidence of recent remodeling. Americans used to U.S.-sized hotel rooms, and those traveling with children might want to consider springing for a "Privilege" room (we did) just to have a little more room to breathe. Breakfast was a wonderful part of each morning in a very chic contemporary lower-level facility, and was substantial, fresh and good-quality. Service was very attentive, and almost everyone we encountered was not only bilingual, but multi-lingual and we were never uncomfortable with our combination of American English and bad French. The hotel staff were warm, friendly and absolutely wonderful at anticipating our needs and taking good care of us at every turn. Special thanks go to Lauren at the front desk, and Marina in the breakfast bar who were absolute gems during our stay. All in all, we felt like we got a 5-star hotel at a 3-star price. We would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a great hotel, would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Tussi284
Reviews.Content: Location The location is great. No, it's super! If you want to be near everything and if you want to live in the 1 arr. it's the perfect hotel. You almost live ON the street with stores like Goyard, Audemars Piguet, Hermès, YSL etc. etc. You can't ask for a better location in this arrondissement. You live minutes away from almost anything, and the beautiful Louvren of course. Hotel The hotel was great as well. For the price we were both very happy! Many hotels that have such great location, can be, well not as nice inside.. But this hotel was great! Our room was super tiny, but everything felt nice and clean. The breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful. The only minus for us must have been the size.. The tiny room and the very small elevator. But that is very common in Paris, and it didn't bother us much at all! Conclusion Super location if you want to stay in the 1 arr. Great hotel for the price that you pay! Helpful staff, clean and nice. Would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Incredible Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Carma73
Reviews.Content: We were two couples who stayed from July 13-17. The hotel was beautiful, clean and in the best location possible. We were on a small side street one block up from the Rue de Rivoli, and 3 - 4 blocks from the Louvre. The Tuileries metro stop was about a block over. The rooms were average for Europe (but small according to American standards). We had rooms 312 and 411. The one comment I will make is that my husband and I had room 312 and the elevator was loud when it closed, but it was really not a problem. The staff was extremely helpful and made great reccomendations for dinner. We also spent some time at the English pub next door. I will definately stay here next time we are in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar position - amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: europaolo
Reviews.Content: Duminy is in an amazing location just 1 min back from the famous Rue de Rivoli and therefore the Louvre, Tuileriies gardens, Place de la Concorde, Musee d'Orsay, Seine, Place Vendome , Opera etc........what a line-up!! This 'best kept secret ' of Paris is a charming little hotel that is tucked away in a quiet location so close to THE famous sites of Paris. It is clean, comfortable, the staff are friendly & helpful <which can be a bonus in Paris> , the breakfast is lovely with many famous Parisian treats. It is a 3* hotel in a 5* locale with many very famous hotels as neighbours (Ritz, Westin,Le Meurice etc). And of course dont forget the famous Angelina's Cafe around the corner in Rue de Rivoli which is reputed to have the best hot chocolate in Paris.... and check out the cakes while you're there... Mamma mia !! We have recommended to 2 friends who have stayed here & both raved about how much they enjoyed this wonderful little haven! One stayed for 2 weeks & they upgraded them to their best room to reward their loyalty & commitment! We'll certainly be back to Duminy every time we travel to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful - will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: montypython51
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights there before our trip to Hungary. It's location is ideal, the rooms were nice and comfortable and the staff were very helpful in every way. The included breakfast was fantastic and room service was also first class. Highly recommended place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Deb2103
Reviews.Content: This small friendly hotel was the perfect location for a weekend in Paris. The location was fantastic a couple of minutes from the Louvre. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and recommended a great restaurant round the corner. The breakfast was lovely in an interesting cellar room, with a good choice. A really great hotel and was perfect for three girls on there own. We would deffinately recommend this hotel and hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Kittenkeeper
Reviews.Content: The staff were super helpful letting us check in early and providing stacks of useful info. Everything was well appointed and the best we have seen for the price in Paris which is always going to be expensive. The small bar next door has everything including character to the max. Perfect for a pre dinner drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Ianandemma
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 stayed here to celebrate the year of our 40th birthdays. The hotel website talks about service, location, sound proofed rooms, cozy bar, and air conditioning. The only good thing is the location, smack bang in the middle of Paris with good access to Metro station.but that is where it all ends, the air con rattles, the Walls are thin, and the bar was being refurbished and was closed, unless you fancied a drink in the lobby!!! When I complained on departure the receptionist just shrugged his shoulders and picked up the phone and ignored me hoping I'd just go away. The bathroom was dirty and the room was so small we could only just fit in there with our one bag. We paid 200 euros per night hoping we'd be able to have a good room in a good location and a cozy bar to meet up in, sadly we were disappointed. We'll never go back just on the ignorance of the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed there in January 2011 with my daughter. I then returned in May 2011 due to the great experience with my wife.”
Reviews.Author: VENDOME79
Reviews.Content: In most cases the French are viewed as quite rude to non French speaking people. The Duminy Vendomes staff can only be described as great advocates to show visitors of non French speaking background just how friendly and caring the French people can be . I have never experienced hotel staff who are prepared to go to such extreme lengths to help .They made a disasterous incident a marvellous out come due to their tenacity and genuine caring of the problem we found ourselves in. The people we dealt with were Julien , Adrien, and Laurene exemplorary staff. The hotels location is central to all of Paris and great to get around from. The hotel is very flexable in relation to helping you out if you turn up early. If there is a negative it can only be some of the rooms are a wee bit small , but that is to be expected in major city centers . One of the major features is the breakfast rooms curved ceiling and the very lovely presented breakfast . I will be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ColinH8838
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Ritz on the Sunday evening but wanted somewhere to book in on the Saturday night so we had an extra night! Looking for a hotel close by and "less expensive" I found the Duminy Vendome. It sounded ideal and well priced for a 3 star hotel. On arrival, our room was ready and although small it was clean, nicely furnished and had all the facilities we needed including coffee making facilities! Room service was fast and not over priced and very tasty! We arrived down late for breakfast by 10 minutes due to a misunderstanding and although officially finished we were still given a table and served our breakfast without being rushed! Although a very short stay, would highly recommend and would stay again! Colin & Andrea - Warrington, UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jlac762
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, so close to a Metro station, a few minutes from the Louvre, Notre Dame, Vedettes du Pont Neuf. The rooms were quite large, comfortable and lovely, bathrooms could be updated. Breakfast was excellent. The staff was lovely and very helpful. Within walking distance of the Paris Opera House. A beautiful hotel. Cannot say enough about the location and how convenient to get everywhere around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in great location with excellent breakfast bar.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller777
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay for us in Paris and it was lovely. Staff very pleasant and spoke good English. Room was lovely and the bed was divine. Get the buffet breakfast- it is yum.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Emmamty
Reviews.Content: Really, really nice little hotel. Very clean and a fantastic location. Staff was very nice. Truly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bindy76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. The location was superb for us - close to the metro and a nice walk to a number of major sights. The staff were very pleasant, the breakfast was wonderful and the room was quiet. Whilst we know it is common of Paris hotels, we found the room tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rmc103
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for the Duminy, it is surrounded by 5 star hotels with doormen and valets. However it is a fantastic location, just off the Rue de Rivoli, near the Louvre and near the boutique shopping on St Honore. The service was excellent - the staff were happy to speak English to us (which is often not the case), breakfast was great. Only warning if travelling with a lot of suitcases: the lift is tiny. Our room was good and was quiet despite being next to the lift (and an irish pub) What really impressed me was when I realised some of my washing was missing once I arrived in the Uk. They found it and posted it to me, was brilliant. Only thing bad about the location: very hard to find good eating places, most were tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, spotlessly clean, fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stpauligirlmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on split days, Sunday and Monday and checked back in on Thursday and Friday. It is a small, comfortable, clean, wonderful little hotel. We had a triple room, which was much bigger than we expected. It had a full sized bath, with a tub and shower combo. The room and bath were spotless, the beds were warm and comfortable and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in room 301 and 101, respectively. The rooms were identical. The room, while not overly large, was plenty big enough for three adults. The "third" bed is a real bed, not a cot. We "peaked" into the room next door when the door was open and being cleaned by a maid. The tiny room had one double bed. The end of the bed was about 2 feet from the door and about 2 feet from the wall on each side. Even though it was very, very small, it also looked cozy and spotless. For me, it would be perfectly adequate for a couple. The elevators are TINY and barely fit three people - two with luggage. The location is across the street from Jardin Tulierre and the Louvre and down the block from Place du Concord. It is steps from several wonderful cafes and close to transit. It is walking distance to the Siene and Pont Neuf. If you are ready for a good stroll, it is walking distance to all the city-center sights, including Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle and D'Orsay. The location is superb for a first-timer in Paris. It is very centrally located. The staff at this hotel are amazing. To a person, they were friendly, welcoming, helpful and polite. They recommended a couple of eating spots, gave directions, and called a taxi to get us back to the airport. Be advised, that if you reserve a taxi ahead of time, you pay an extra 9+ Euro charge. We were not brave enough to try getting back to Charles De Gaulle by train, because we were afraid to get lost and miss our flight. This was silly. The hotel is a short-medium walk to the RER, which would have gotten us directly to CDG. The distance is just far enough that if you have more than one rolling suitcase, it will be difficult to walk. I highly recommend this wonderful little hotel. It made our stay in Paris exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UkIzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as an 18th birthday treat for my daughter and a friend. The Duminy Vendome is the best hotel we have stayed at in Paris - an amazing location for shopping and sightseeing, and the staff were fantastic - especially those on the front desk. Nothing was too much trouble - they booked restaurants, hailed cabs, recommended the quickest ways to all the sights, and brought us drinks in the little bar. The rooms are spotless with good bathrooms, and fairly quiet although next time we would book one not right by the lift, as it was a little noisy first thing in the morning. The beds are really comfy with top quality duvets and pillows. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Exceded Expectations, Very clean and Helpful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: devonpearman
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, stayed here due to the fact that we had tours booked with Viator and the Paris Vision office is right around the corner. The hotel is immaculately kept and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a treat with hot and cold plates available. I think this hotel is great value for money and I would recommend it to anyone that is going on tours through Paris vision or looking for somewhere comfortable and well priced to stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Natian08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife,young baby and extended family.The staff were absolutely fantastic and couldnt do enough for you,from reception to the breakfast staff.The room was a good size and had all we needed including a baby cot.The location couldnt have been better,the louvre a 5 min walk,chanps elysee and arc de triomph 10 and the eiffel tower 15 min walk,absolutely perfect.Being near the centre there was a great variety of restaurants nearby and an irish bar next door.The man working at breakfast was brilliant and always remembered my coffee order without me asking,didnt have a chance to thank him as he was off on my last day.I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaroleNye Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Paris I have stayed in. It was in the heart of the city - so close to the centre of town. The room was spacious and very nicely decorated. The bathroom was also really fantastic. The bed was so comfortable and there was a tea/coffee maker, flat screen TV, hairdryer, safe etc. The staff were so friendly and helpful and there was a lovely bar where we had our 'night cap'. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and is definitely where I will stay next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff - helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Miss001
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a broken leg and the staff at the hotel were really helpful in advising me about wheelchair hire etc before my visit. When we arrived we were given a room on the second floor. The wallpaper was coming off the walls in the corridor and it looked a bit shabby, but there were signs apologising for this, saying it was being refurbished. The room was fine - clean and tidy, with tea making facilities, a tv, shower / bath, wardrobe, hairdryer and a comfy bed. We spent one night here, but it was very small and being on crutches made it almost impossible to get into the bathroom and to the wardrobe. I asked if there was any chance of getting a bigger room and the receptionist spoke to the manager and moved us into a larger room on the ground floor. This was perfect and I could even fit my wheelchair in. The staff were amazing - they were really friendly, approachable and eager to help with any queries. They booked taxis, made dinner reservations and gave good advice on excursions. Breakfast was great - you get more selection if you go down to the breakfast room but it's good to have the option to have room service if you fancy a lie-in. There is a nice bar area and the shared areas are very clean, attractively decorated and tidy. The location is perfect for sight-seeing - within a short stroll from the Louvre, the Champs Elysees, Place Vendome / Concorde and lots of nice restaurants. I would throughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond our expectations... !”
Reviews.Author: kiwirunner10
Reviews.Content: .This charming small hotel was such a pleasant surprise for us, even better than the photos and previous reviews. Spotlessly clean, wonderful comfy beds with pristine white linen and tastefully decorated rooms. Excellent staff and service, with delicious buffet breakfast, all located in a smart and sophisticated location. Close to many good restaurants, world class boutique shopping and landmark attractions such as Le Louvre. We highly recommend the Duminy Vendome. Ros and Zac, AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - perfect location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: v8disco
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel purely based on Tripadvisor reviews and it was every bit as good as the reviews led me to believe. The location is perfect. Down a quiet street but a short walk from the Louvre one way and the Place de la Concorde the other. The Champs Elysee and Eiffel Tower are also easy walking distance. The room (210) was excellent but we did have the privalage room so I have no idea what the standard rooms were like. The room was clean and very quiet with a large bathroom. The breakfast room was in the basement and beautifully presented - and the breakfasts were also excellent. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. next door is a really good Irish bar that we spent a little time in. Local restaurents are good but city centre prices. The exception was the Sapporo Japanese restaurent which was small, packed, friendly, served excellent food and was very reasonably priced. All in all and excellent choice and I would have no heistation in going back. I found it cheapest through BA.COM who i would recommend for hotel booking.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Great Location, Magical City”
Reviews.Author: themozzer
Reviews.Content: My wife, mother-in-law and myself had the great pleasure of staying at this hotel from 27th Dec 2010 to 30th Dec 2010 in a Privilege Triple Room (301) including breakfast. The hotel was better than we had hoped with an ideal location for walking to the shopping areas or going to Notre Dame and the Louvre. The triple room itself was perfect for 3 adults and was excellently clean with large bathroom, min-bar, TV and coffee making facilities. It also included additional pillows and 3 bathroom robes for us to use. The staff were always polite and would help with anything we required. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to see the sights in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it a lot.”
Reviews.Author: itsmej
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and simple but clean. The highlight I think is the breakfast buffet. It was fantastic and set a nice tone for the day. The locations is extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service with a great location to all you need to see in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: westfield002
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and the staff was outstanding. At the concierge's desk was a woman by the name of Arina who couldn't have been more helpful . Her recommendations were excellent , her demeanor was always professional , and her customer service was world class... you're very fortunate to have her on your staff. The housekeeping services were exceptional. We were also very impressed with the breakfast that was serviced in the morning with a large variety of dishes that would satisfy any guest. Overall our stay was outstanding. Jerry & Sharon Wright

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Nice Staff , Good Breaksfast , Sleep Well and Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: armam
Reviews.Content: This is first trip to Paris....We stayed there for 4 nights and I prefer the Duminy Vendome . It is great located and near to the Tuilleries Metro, close to the Louvre and the Tuilleries gardens ,around hotel have many restaurant and near shopping street , no traffic noise, nice staff, best breakfast , Bed is comfortable!! ,Clean. But have small elevator and wi-fi is not for free. The standard room is enough for couple but If you come more than 2 people I suggest to reservation bigger room is better. Near hotel have restaurant to open on Sunday is " L'Ardoise" is great food,good taste,best price. Everything is good. If you come to Paris --Duminy Vendome is good choice. Small but Nice Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location! Very confortable room.”
Reviews.Author: AleDeri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been at this hotel on vacation with our three year-old daughter. We have chosen a "Privilège" room facing the back of the building, since we had been informed about the pub possible noise. The room was quite confortable and its size very good. The bathroom was also great in size and beauty. The breakfast is outstanding for European standards. Besides, the restaurant is very charming. Very near the subway station (just a block away) and a walking distance from main attractions such as Louvre Museum, Jardin desTuileries and Place de la Concorde. Rue St. Honoré, with its great shops is also just a block away. A great parking can be found at Rue des Pyramides, where you can even book a spot via web. Highly recommended!! We have decided it will be our "official" hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - close to major tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: HBS23_10
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a quiet streetwithin walking distance to major attractions - Lourve 5-10 minutes. Large comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “YES! STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: MBH3
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris....and the Duminy Vendome was fantastic. It is very well located and a 1 minute walk to the Tuilleries Metro stop. Quiet street, so no traffic noise, yet one block and you're on the Rue de Rivoli. We stayed there for 2 nights, then on a tour, then back for 6 nights. The first room--202 was VERY small---OK for one but very tight for two. The staff was absolutely wonderful and accepted our request for 'anything a bit bigger in the same price range?" (for the 6 night stay). They put us in 504 which was fantastic, and perfect! Thanks to all at DV for a clean, pleasant, well run hotel! The staff at the front desk made everything run with spirit and personal attention. An unexpected plus is that Carr's irish pub is right next door---a fun stop after a long day of walking around; and very friendly folks. We want to go back to Paris and stay at the DV!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location near all the major atttractions”
Reviews.Author: HelenW59
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my elderly mother (73) for her first trip to Paris. The hotel is in a wonderful location allowing us to visit the sites eg Louvre about 1/2km away, or use the open-top buses, and then return to the hotel for a rest before venturing out again. The room was quite small and the twin beds couldn't be separated but we managed. It might be an issue if you are travelling with a friend rather than a partner or close relative! The breakfasts were plentiful and all the staff were friendly and helpful. It was a bit noisy on the Friday night as there is an Irish pub next door, but it wasn't too bad. It is quite expensive but if you are after a great locaion, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, polished by great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Terrierboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the hotel which is very close to the Tuileries Metro. After an al fresco lunch in the Tuileries Gardens we checked in. We were greeted by very friendly staff and found our Privelege room on the fourth floor to be very clean and much larger than other reviews had left me expecting. The rue de Mont Thabor is a quiet road and we did not experience any excessive noise from the adjacent Irish pub. The minibar was large enough to store a few snacks we bought and unlike other minibars, it also kept the contents quite cool. The bathroom was large, very clean and supplied with adequate towels and toiletries. However, it was a little dated but well maintained. No free wi-fi. We asked the receptionist for a dinner recommendation for Sunday night but despite her advice, the Auberge St Roch in nearby rue St Roch was closed. Instead we ate at Les Fines Gueles in rue Croix des Petits Champs and had a great meal in a really buzzing atmosphere. We ate at Auberge St Roch on Monday night and had an equally good meal, albeit in a more homely, traditionally French setting. Breakfast at the hotel is served in the basement breakfast room. Despite the lack of natural light, it is a welcoming, pleasant environment providing good quality food and drink. Scrambled eggs and sausages were the hot choices during our stay. The reception staff were very helpful in arranging a taxi to the station at the end of our stay despite the general strike ! In summary - a clean, well presented small hotel in a great central but quiet location. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: frmalarky
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating staff--rooms were clean and for the most part, quiet. Breakfast was served in a charming area; very tastefully decorated and the choices of food would please anyone. The location was extremely convenient for the Metro, Louvre, Tuilleries Gardens, Place Vendome, Paris Vision (tours). One could just head out the door in any direction and have a beautiful walk. Down the street was Le Souffle restaurant--and across the street a great Chinese restaurant; all with reasonable prices and good food. And a real bonus was the darling Irish Pub next door with incredible piano players!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Brock9
Reviews.Content: Friends stayed at this hotel 1 year ago and recommended it mainly due to the great location. When planning our own trip this year initially the rates were quite high and we shopped around for a different hotel. Thanks to Trip Advisor, we booked the hotel via the internet with no problems whatsoever for a price we were more than happy with as opposed to a price our travel agent could secure. The location is fantastic, Irish Pub right next door, close to most of the popular sights with the Metro station nearby in case you want to travel further afield. Staff were courteous at all times and the breakfast was very good. We were fully aware that hotel rooms in Paris were on the small side and so were not disappointed when we walked into our room. Just enough space to put 2 large suitcases down. The bathroom was quite large considering how small the bedroom was. Whilst we could hear noises from an adjoining room, it did not bother us one iota. For a 3 star hotel, it is very good and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, safe hotel in which to stay. We stayed for 9 nights. Perhaps shop around for the best price you can get for this hotel as there are bargains to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCountry15
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located and central to all the main attractions without it being on a main road. We had a "privledge" room which was very spacious. The breakfast was adequate and the wait staff very attentive. The staff were very friendly & spoke good english, although there was one female staff member who was very rude to us upon arrival (beware the dark haired one wearing glasses). The hotel website advertises the rooms are soundproof. This really is not the case. We could hear talking & TV sounds quite clearly from the room next to us as well as doors slamming, the elevator doors closing & the laundry shute was located outside our room. Luckily our neighbours didn't come in too late at night. There was a supermarket around the corner & plenty of cafes within walking distance. WiFi was expensive at 8 Euro an hour. All hotels should be providing free internet access these days!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: manuelgbma
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London via the Eurostar and did not find one taxi driver willing to take our family of four to our hotel because the Tour de France was on its last day the Sunday afternoon of our arrival. We had no option but to to try to find our way using the unfamiliar Metro system and after two hellish hours in that maze with everything marked an exit but not an exit, we emerged at LeHalles and found a taxi willing to take two of us to our hotel leaving our teenage boys on some corner while we got within two blocks of our hotel and walked the rest of the way, with lots of luggage in hand. We found the hotel staff to be helpful in our frantic attempt to find our sons and after we were all together, we looked around and starting enjoying Paris a little more. The rooms were fine, clean and not worn and the dining area downstairs kicked it up a notch with the modern interior. The food was very good and there was plenty for everyone. The hotel has a few quirks like the slow lifts but we found the hotel very nice and aesthetically pleasing. We didn't know if it was a great value because we booked through American Express in Phoenix, AZ and didn't care too much about the rate-it seemed fair, but the location was great and we loved the close proximity to the Louvre. We'd stay there again. The Aguirre Family

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations, good location”
Reviews.Author: TrekRef
Reviews.Content: Would neither recommend or not recommend but since TA requires this field, will reluctantly recommend because the price was right. Sleeping room and bathroom was very small. WiFi cost 8 Euro for one hour. Front desk staff seemed bothered at times. But nice breakfast in the dungeon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - especially if travelling with toddlers.”
Reviews.Author: TheDinas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best 3 star hotels we've stayed in. It was clean, modern and in a brilliant location. The hotel lifts are the size of shoe boxes and extremely slow, so thats probably the only fault with the hotel itself. In terms of the hotel staff, make sure you not only ask but have it written on your invoice/rconfirmation letter if breakfast is included. We were told it was included and it wasn't, so after some heated conversations with the manager, we received breakfast complimentary due to their mistake. This also happened to another family that we saw having the same issue. So have it in writting! Location: Everything was within a couple of minutes walk. The metro is about 50 meters around the corner and will take you anywhere you need to get to including Gare du Nord (Eurostar terminal) and the airports - note though that we did not find a single train station that was luggage or pram friendly - loads of stairs, so be prepared to carry your luggage up stairs. The gardens (Jardins du Tuilleries) are 1 block away - was a great place to take our 4 year old son every day to run around. Make sure you try the macaroons from Angelinas before heading to the park. They are to die for! The gardens lead to the Lourve where all the action is and on the opposite end of the gardens, that same road becomes the Champs Elysee that ends at the Arc du Triumph. All within walking distance. The best place to shop is Galleries LaFayette. There are 3 entire blocks worth of shops and is about a 2-3 block walk from the hotel. We walked to the Eiffel Tower many times during our stay. That is a long walk though - about 25 mins - but you can opt to catch the metro which is around the corner from the hotel instead and takes you right to the Eiffel tower in about 3 stops. We also took the metro to Palais de Versailles. Very easy to get to, but our tip is to be there early. It gets absolutely PACKED with people. We waited over 1 hour just to get a ticket to get in. In summary, the hotel was located in quiet street next to some of the very posh and very expensive hotels, within walking distance to anywhere you want to get to. The hotel was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Aside from the tiny lifts and incident with breakfast (which tasted delicious by the way), I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is clean, comfortable and rooms are...”
Reviews.Author: MDFD
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, comfortable and rooms are well equipped. Service is good, friendly and staff are happy to speak English. At first, they tried to put us in the ground floor room but we had only set foot inside the door when we heard the constant trickle of liquid (hopefully just water) coming down through pipework behind the wall. They moved us to a far better room on the second floor. Breakfast is quite good, a buffet served in their tres chic basement. Quite strange though: they were playing a CD of American Christian rock over the sound system, which was a bit surreal. We took it to be the personal choice of the maitre D. It was funny at first, but got a bit annoying after the fourth track. However, I intend staying there next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of going back....”
Reviews.Author: elpidoushka
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. I stayed alone in a double room, which was small but livable, still very clean and accurate. Coffee maker is a plus. Great breakfast in a nice room. Great location!!! I wish i can go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dont take room on ground floor”
Reviews.Author: southlanarksire
Reviews.Content: Went to Duminy Vendome on Valentines day and night before and had booked lunch in Effiel Tower, Coach tour and River cruise through viatour which departed from end of Rue D'Algiers which was a stone's throw from hotel. Location was excellent, literally 10 minutes walk from Lourve with McDonalds en route for lovers of Le Big Mac. Subway at end of road and lots of shopping therapy available. We had room on ground floor which was noisy from pedestrian traffic on street, particularly from Irish Bar next door and the plumbing contributed to interupted sleep. Nice breakfast and staff were very obliging and happy to speak in English without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: sleepingbeauty_10
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in the best part of the city. Everything within walking distance. Staff went above and beyond to make sure our week there was a memorable one. Breakfast served every morning was fresh and had many choices to chose from. I would recommend it to anyone who wanted the best location at the best price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Spinnaker3
Reviews.Content: Good small hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Breakfasts are excellent in the basement. Rooms we stayed in were a little petite, but were clean and well appointed. The lifts between floors are very very small and take a long time to arrive - we used the staircase a lot, so that was no problem.No restaurant is not a problem as the location is so central and there are plenty to choose from. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay it if I were you!!”
Reviews.Author: Notsothrilled
Reviews.Content: Looks much newer and better on the website than it is. Bathrooms outdated and missing tiles, holes left unpatched, no "lookey-loos" (peep holes to see who is on the other side) or chains, small rooms. Noisy from the Irish Pub next door. If you are unfortunate enough to get a room next to the elevators, you will hear it every time it is called. Speaking of elevators...they are downright SCARY!! Coffin-sized and shakey!! Now for the really bad part!! Our sons' room was ROBBED our first night there. As in STOLE their whole carry-on bags!! The front desk was like "It's no big deal..." and said they hadn't been ROBBED since last summer--like that made us feel better!! Not!! Filing French police reports wasn't not the way we would have chosen to spend our morning either!! While we were at the police station, another guest on our floor called and reported he was also ROBBED!! Won't go back!! No way, no how. We've done a lot of traveling and this hotel turned out to be below our standards even before we got ROBBED. Location is not everything, not by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in quiet street”
Reviews.Author: europe09Adelaide
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, we stayed 4 nights. It is in a quiet street just a little way from great shopping, gardens and major attractions. This hotel was very comfortable, we had a large room with a decent sized bathroom. The breakfast included in the room rate was good value. Only a short walk to the Tulleries Gardens and the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mainiac_in_York
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed here for a week. The hotel is centrally located in the city and is very easy to walk to many most attractions. The staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke english. The cloth tablecloths and our own pot of coffee was a nice surprise at breakfast . As others have noted the walls are thin so it can be noisy. But all in all the hotel really exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PickyGATraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and overall the price was excellent for the location, we paid 130E a night which included breakfast. We were right around the corner from the Ritz and Place de Vendome, the surroundings were very upscale. We were able to walk most places and it was also very close to the metro. The room was decent, it had a Parisian decor and the window opened up and overlooked the street. We were in the lowest price category, so maybe other rooms have better bathrooms and amenities.There was a strong cigarette smell, which really bothered us but everyone smokes in France so maybe that's to be expected. The breakfast was fantastic and offered excellent service. The staff were very helpful and kind. I would recommend to anyone on a budget. One tip I have is to check out the company website: Espirit de France hotels, that is where we found the best rate and their other hotels look equally nice and are also in great locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MGT302
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a sightseeing trip to Paris. The location is ideal to visit central Paris and see all the sights literally 5 minutes walk from the Louvre. On check-in we found that although we booked through Thomson, the hotel did not have our booking. The staff were very helpful in sorting out the problem and luckily they had a room for us. The rooms are small but clean and all we needed for a sightseeing tour. Breakfast was excellent and the staff always polite and happy to help. Our room overlooked a courtyard and although you could hear noise in the mornings this did not bother us. If you don't want noise don't go to a city!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ticaramist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum and was very pleased with standard of hotel. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was great. Would definetely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Minilr
Reviews.Content: The Duminy Vendome Hotel is located perfectly, 2 blocks away from the Tulleries and the metro station (metro number one, that goes beside de Sena all across Paris), and 3 blocks away from the most elegant area in Paris, Place Vendome, where the Ritz is located. The breakfast is great! Enjoy the delicious french croissants and start you day with plenty of energy! The bad things about this hotel: the photos at the hotel web site don't reflect the real thing, is not so nice on the inside as it appears to be on the photos. Not the reception, neither the rooms. They are so so small! But clean. And if you are a sleeper in the morning, you will be woken up by the noise of doors shutting along the alley by the cleaning staff. If your idea is to stroll around the city all day, is a perfect hotel. But if you want to enjoy the hotel, don't come here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Denalan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a city break through Thomson travelling by Eurostar. Hotel so easy to get to only two minutes walk from Tullieries Metro station. Was pleasanlty surprised to find when my wife and myself arrived at the hotel that they had upgraded us to a Privelege room. We had a wonderful room on the third floor at the front of the hotel which we found very quiet despite comments by others to the contrary. Cannot fault this hotel everything was perfect. The location is only a few minutes walk from the Louvre and other sights. Because of the central location it was useful to go back to the hotel during the day to recharge your batteries before heading off for a further exploration of Paris. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and cannot understand how anyone can make negative comments about it. As one person said perhaps those people need to go to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “what out for the pub next door”
Reviews.Author: Lambiri
Reviews.Content: Location was spot on, the rooms are fine bar the worn down bathrooms in some rooms. Interior has charm. Staff are great. BUT WHAT EVER YOU DO GET A ROOM ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE HOTEL AS STREET SIDE YOU WILL HEAR THE IRISH PUB DRINKERS ON THE STREET TIL AROUND 3 AT NIGHT. Was a real [--] to hear them every night. Otherwise you'll be fine

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not such a great value”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night last September. I booked again last month, but when getting there they had no room for me. They were quite apologetic. Paid the cab fare to take me to another place (a Mercure) not too far. Still, I could not help getting the feeling that after I had booked (through venere.it) -at EUR 180, cheaper than the EUR 200 that they offered on their own web site, they were able to sell more rooms at a much higher rate. But then, that's speculation, and they handled the situation as well as they could. As to the hotel, I suppose that for people looking to visit that part of town it's great. I merely stayed there because I booked fairly late and the other places where I usually stay (typically at somewhat lower rates) were all full. The one time I actually stayed, they actually gave me a fairly large room. People are OK, service and breakfast are fine. This said, one can arguably do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless clean with great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbarka
Reviews.Content: I have spend only one night (19th July) in this hotel which I chose after reading positive reviews on tripadvisor. As I was travelling with my sister and her daughter we had to take bigger room (Privilege). The room was not very big, but we had enough space. This is really very pleasant and welcoming hotel. You really feel like guest treated with warm smile and great hospitality. Hotel service is discrete and always with smile. Rates are slightly too high but at least you really get what you paid for. And maybe something more... I was surprised to find dressing gowns in bathhroom and real orchids in my room. On your arrival bottle of mineral water and lovely buiscuits are waiting, so you can unpack, make yourself cuppa and relax before exploring Paris. I did not have breakfast there so cannot judge but price of 17Euros really put me off especially that I am not big breakfast eater. For the 1/3 of this price you can have simple breakfast in every nearby cafe. There is Tea Room around the corner open even on Sunday. If you fancy beer in Irish pub you will find it just 10 metres from hotel entrance. I really cannot find anything to complain about this hotel. So I will definitely stay there again. No more cold treatment from Holiday Inn and Novotel!!! Such a big difference!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel duminy vendome-a 3 star hotel with a 4 star value”
Reviews.Author: annaisrael
