Reviews.Content: this small , nice hotel in place vendome -was a wonderful experience- clean, quiet, centrally located. even air conditioned- a rich, breakfast-polite and a helpful staff and reception people. i give them a 10!!! hanna schulman,israel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanmarr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the best neighborhood! You can walk easily to anywhere and the metro stop is less than two blocks. This hotel is very stylish and well kept. To complain in general about this hotel, at these rates, you are a high maintenance guest and might want to consider The Ritz which is right down the street. I read every review before I came and most do not do justice to this hotel. The rooms are clean,comfortable and above my expectations. The staff was very helpful and friendly, always with a smile. Breakfast is perfect and service in the dinning room excellent. The basement dinning room is beautiful! Sausages, eggs, cereal, pastries all worth the extra price which is much less then one would pay outside the hotel. If you have a room looking over the street, it can be loud in the evening as there are other hotels and restaurants on the block BUT you will find this everywhere in Paris...get over it and shut your window or you can request a room in the rear looking over the courtyard. I would stay here again with NO hesitation. This hotel has made my stay in Paris wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Value”
Reviews.Author: StarNvigator
Reviews.Content: Small, small, small, from the rooms to the ellevators. We had to store some of our luggage in the bathroom! Breakfast offered a great range. But coming back to our room after exploring Paris at the end of the day was a real downer! The rooms offer no exras at all. Basic through and through. The airconditioner was noisy and sounded like a flushing toilet. The toilet did not flush properly. There was no minibar and the decor was so basic. Overall Bad Value!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just two blocks away from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duminy Vendome hotel with my wife as it was perfectly located near the Olympia theatre. We spend a perfect week-end in Paris to see James Taylor in conert. The property is perfectly located just 100 m. away from Tulleries metro station. It is also only two blocks away from the Ritz and Place Vendôme and it is a very good option for the budget concious. The front desk satff is very nice and helpful, they speak perfect English and also understand a bit of Spanish. The rooms are not big, but they are clean and have been recently renovated. We stayed at a room on the first floor and we were not annoyed by any noise. The breakfast buffet is above average and has plenty different breakfast options... The hotel has some pretty fine restaurants around, but you shiould be advised by any good guide such as Lonely Planet or Rough Guide so as to avoid any tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ideal location”
Reviews.Author: toulouselautrek
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel in a good area, super location for most attractions comfortable rooms and super bar. its quite bohemian inside with a fantastic restaurant for breakfast., a real find in a great city. go to the restaurant le souffle just down the street, what a find. dont go to the restaurant le grand colbert its rubbish. hop on and off batobus on the seine to get arround and see the sights. this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Nomad
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for its location. Metro stop just round the corner and the Champs Elysee and Louvre a very comfortable walking distance with cafes, bars and restaurants all on your doorstep. Naturally, like any hotel the rooms are slightly different sizes and grades. We were on the bottom floor near reception (Rm 101) which was large and extremely comfortable. The rest of the party were in a room on the 3rd floor which was also very nice but did suffer from some street noise they said. Overall, none of us had anything to complain about. Breakfast was pretty good and served in the hotel basement. The staff were very helpful and sociable. A bit expensive, but you do get what you pay for. I'm planning to stay there again this year...I think that says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located & Great Value........Will definately stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jared&Rachel
Reviews.Content: We staryed in the Duminy from Nov. 2nd-5th , 2007. We got a package for 2 from Charleston, SC to Paris 3 nights in the Duminy then a flight to Rome and 4 nights in the River Palace and then a flight home , including taxes, fees and insurance for $3200.00. I researched all 100+ hotels available in the package in each of the 2 cities. We were very impressed with the Duminy. The location was perfect, 5 minutes walk from the Louve and 3 minutes from the Metro stop. You can reach most anywhere in the city from the Metro, it is set up perfectly and is an easy way to get around. The hotel was very clean and had a breakfast included each morning that was very nice, eggs, sausage, coffee, juices, pastries, yogurt, cereal. This alone saved over $10 Euro per person per day. The rooms were small but very nice, clean, and quiet, we did not spend very much time in the room other than to sleep and shower. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. We did take an amazing bike tour from BIKE ABOUT TOURS, the first day we got to Paris, 3 hrs long all over the city, an american guide who explained history and sights. My mother-in-law is not an adventurous person and thought this was her favorite activity in Paris. You can contact them at info@bikeabouttours.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location!!”
Reviews.Author: sima1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for touring the city. The location is EXCELLENT. You are one block back from the Tuileries metro stop and the gardens themselves! Fabulous bakery if you head towards the Louvre on the Rue de Rivoli. The rooms are very small as are most rooms in Paris, but it is perfect if you are out and about most of the time as we were. The beds are very comfy and the staff is wonderful. The room was very quite. We were not in the hotel much at all, but the sleeping time we were there was very nice. I can't say enough about the location! You stay smack in the middle of Paris at a fraction of the cost. When we go back we will definitely stay at the Duminy Vendome again!

Reviews.Title: “Coupe Du Mond Rugby 2007”
Reviews.Author: SWARBRS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location, turn right out of hotel and your 5 minutes from the Louvre and Tulleries Gradens and the Metro station. Good buffet style breakfast served from 6.30 to 10.00. No need to take hairdryer as one supplied in bathroom. Good maid and room service. Very helpful Reception Staff.

Reviews.Title: “not so friendly”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here through a Go Today package and also encouraged our friends from the Uk to stay here as well. We were all there for 7 days. While we speak pretty good French (it was my major in college) and we are well travelled, I found the staff quite rude. The rooms were OK. Nothing special. Location was excellent. What really ticked me off was that we were there for a week visiting our daughter who was studying for the semester at the Sorbonne. We had encouraged our English friends to join us. They paid an exhorbitant price for their room to be with us for the week. The morning we were leaving, we had checkied out early. We needed to phone our daughter. They would not let us do that from the desk phone. I found this really petty since we had brought them so much business...not to mention the inconvenience of running outside in the rain to find a pay phone... and it was only a local paris call..Very lacking in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “From Sydney with Love”
Reviews.Author: daccordfrenchies
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic and within a few minutes stroll to Jardin des Tuileries. From there you can hop on the metro and off you go. It's also an easy walk to the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. We had asked for our room to be available upon arrival and we were delighted when we booked in about 8.00 am that it was - without any extra charge. Very comfy and great breakfast facilities. The room and bathroom were spacious considering the age of the building. Service was fabulous and the staff were super friendly and helpful. If you want a reasonably priced hotel in the 1st arrondissement - this may be the one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayauckland
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a wonderful cruise and a week in Tuscany and were ready for our Paris 3 night stay. The hotel is in a great location handy to everything. The room was a little smaller than used to but very clean. Breakfast area lovely and great selection. For the price and location a great place to stay. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay here don't get a single!”
Reviews.Author: luv_travelling2
Reviews.Content: Duminy Vendome is at an excellent location, on a corner of two quiet streets and 150 feet from rue de Rivoli and the Tuillerie gardens. This is about all I can recommend about it. I stayed here for one night on Sept. 29th. Booked a single room for 185 euros knowing it could not be worth it, but Paris was full with the Fashion week and Apple expo. But I did not expect to end up in a closet! There was a twin bed in the room and 2 feet of space between it and the desk. May be there were three feet between the foot of the bed and the window. The bathroom door could not be opened even half-way or it would've hit the toilet bowl. There was no bidet in the bathroom. As in too many other French hotels, sound-proofing was poor. An additional unfortunate thing is the Irish pub in the same building, so you can listen to drunken screaming on a Saturday night (which it was). Last but not least, the front desk staff (except one young lady who checked me in) was something else. When I came down to ask if all their singles were this small, the answer was "Yes. You can book a double as a single for more room". And in the morning, when I wanted to get out of there fast, the front desk person was happily chatting on the phone with me standing by waiting to check out. After my drumming of fingers got him to hang up, he did a bit but within a minute picked up another call!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the summer at the Place Vendome”
Reviews.Author: Nabby1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights from 24 August 2007. The hotel is on a quiet one-way side street, just round the corner from the Tuileries metro station and gardens. Next door is an Irish pub which didn't seem to cause any problems regarding noise at night. Positives: The very friendly staff, both at reception and in the breakfast room. The quiet room we were allocated (room 001, which has a view of the courtyard, as we requested). The facilities in the room included a mini-bar (€3.00 for a soft drink, €4.00 for a beer), trouser press and a flat screen tv. The room was ready for us when we arrived just after 10 am on Friday morning - very impressive! The selection at breakfast was excellent and of high quality. The location is good, with the Louvre, the Orangerie and the Seine a 10 minute walk, the Musee d'Orsay a 20 minute stroll, the Opera a 15 minute walk and the shops on Boulevard Hausmann about 20 to 25 minutes away on foot. Negatives: Our room was a little cramped and had a normal size (4 feet) double bed, rather than a king (5 feet) or super-king (6 feet) sized bed There was no safe for us to use in the room, something we've got accustomed to when travelling around Europe and the USA. Tips: If you feel like a luxurious treat, take a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the Place Vendome and have a cocktail at the Hemingway Bar in the Ritz Hotel. We really enjoyed this! There's a great restaurant called Alcazar that we went to for dinner. The Arc de Triomphe is open until pretty late at night and you can get great views from the top of the Eiffel Tower all lit up.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in the City of Lights”
Reviews.Author: nikki70
Reviews.Content: We booked for three nights and stayed an extra night because it was such a wonderful hotel. The room was lovely -- I appreciated that it was so obviously well maintained and tastefully designed. Nothing I hate more than checking into a hotel that looks great in pictures but when you get there, you see the chipped paint, water stains, worn carpets, etc. This room was immaculate. Everything worked, the room was quiet and we had two huge windows that opened to the street -- allowing in the fresh air and atmosphere of the neighbourhood. The location is excellent -- quiet street just as it advertises but close to everything. You can walk to most of the major sites but also have only a short walk to the metro station. There are a couple of great restaurants nearby and the area all around Place Vendome and the Opera are bustling. Place Vendome is fun for all its high end shops. Car buffs will enjoy seeing very expensive cars driving around the neighbourhood. The staff was great - very friendly and professional. The breakfast down in the cellar was delicious, of course! And near the hotel, one could find a self-serve laundromat and dry cleaning and laundry services (a big money saver). Loved this hotel - will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay next a $1200 a night hotel for 1/5 of the price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbohun
Reviews.Content: OK the rooms are a little small..but you are in a great location..on a quiet street..a block from the subway and the Tuileries. The Maurice is next door and the Ritz is two blocks away. If its good enough for them..it is GREAT for you!!! I booked on advance so I got a great price. Check different search engines and try to find one with Breakfast included...there really isnt anywhere cheap for breakfast near by.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: taneveninwinter
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms at this hotel as part of our European Family Vacation. We are from the US. Not sure what the other reviewers mean by great location. This hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from anything. My husband and I stayed on the 6th floor. (room 608) Room was a decent size. A bit outdated (especially the bathroom). We had MAJOR problems with the shower. Some days we had no water pressure at all. We would be in the middle of a shower and the water would just go to a trickle. When we did have pressure the water would constantly switch from scalding to freezing. My brothers stayed on the 5th floor and had problems with the water temperature as well. My parents were on the second floor (Room 201) and my sister on the first floor had no complaints about the water. As referenced above, the hotel put the four rooms on four different floors. They did this knowing that we were travelling as a family. The hotel elevators (there were two of them) were EXTREMELY small and were a bit scary. The breakfast room appeared to be newly renovated in a black and white very trendy theme (a major contradiction to the rest of the hotel). The breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “quaint lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetknees
Reviews.Content: We stated here and found it to be everything we wanted in a hotel at a reasonable price. The room was small but had everything we needed and bed was very comfortable. the room was very clean and staff were friendly considering they were french. Breakfast was excellent a good variety of food and fresh. Service was good also and we were never kept waiting. The elevator was on the small size but we never had any problems with it. The hotel was very close to tourist sites and within walking distance to everything. A very pleasant stay and if we ever went back to Paris we would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: muchtraveled
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in the middle of Paris, a short walk from just about all the major sights you want to see. Typical of hotels in Paris, rooms are small. But we didn't stay in the room too much beside sleeping and showering.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination - price & location!”
Reviews.Author: DeeEmmTee
Reviews.Content: Date: March 2007 Reviewer: David from Orpington, Kent Very central (a stone's throw from the Louvre) and yet very reasonably priced? Must be something wrong with it ... NO, in fact it was a little gem! The room was small (as we expected) but clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke English a darn sight better than I spoke French. Perfectly placed for a walking tour of central Paris. Also close to TWO Metro stations if you want to go further afield ... or are simply lazy! (Drivers beware - Trying to park anywhere in the vicinity is virtually impossible.) We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the food. Overall: Good quality, good value, good location. We couldn't have asked for a better base for our Paris trip. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “No Need to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxFaninNYC
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Duminy for 7 nights on our recent trip to Paris. The hotel was perfect. The cost was more than perfect. The rooms were very clean and had especially large bathrooms for a European hotel. The staff at the front desk, as well as the breakfast attendents were very friendly and helpful with any questions. The location is perfect for seeing eveything Paris has to offer!! You are within walking distance of the Louvre, and about 100 yards from a Metro stop which can be used to visit the entire city. (Being from NYC and used to mass transit, we found the Metro to be incredibly clean, safe, and reliable) The hotel is also very close to excursion company locations (Paris Vision, Travelrama, etc....) where you can obtain additional assistance or book nightime cruises and trips to Versaille. Considering everything we had the best vacation of our life in Paris (and we have visited multiple countries in Europe). It is a beautiful city, with outstanding food and sights to see. We will definitley return, and will stay at the Duminy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappyJackAZ
Reviews.Content: We booked Duminy Vendome through British Airways Holidays after I had done a lot of research into other hotels. I figured with the location and price, it couldn't be beat. I read tripadvisor reviews afterwards & wondered if we'd gotten ourselves into a bad idea based on the few negative reviews. Instead, our experience was superlative. I don't know what other people are looking for in a European hotel, but this one is great. The breakfast room has been totally updated in the past 2 months (in fact not totally finished when we were there) and is bright & shiny, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent with assorted rolls, eggs, sausages, yogurts & cheeses, coldcuts, cereal. What more do you need? It kept us going for hours and eliminated the need to figure out where to go in the morning. Our bed was pretty hard (better than too soft!) but the sheets were crisp and nice, the towels big and thick, the toiletries good. Our room was small but perfectly adequate. The staff was all courteous and friendly as well. We were there at a slow time of year and noise was never an issue as other reviews have complained. The hotel is on a quiet side street but we did ask for a courtyard room as suggested. The Hotel Ritz is about 2 blocks away, the metro 2 minutes, the Jardin des Tuileries right there as well. Many hotels are near metro stops, but this one is near lovely sights AND the metro. We would readily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Geekyblonde
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel really can't be beat...just one block from the Metro station, a five minute walk from the obelisk, tulip gardens, and the Louvre; and just 10 minutes from the Arc Du Triumph, and Notre Dame! The rooms were of a reasonable size by european standards, clean, and quiet. I will unquestionably stay there again for my next trip to Paris. I booked this hotel with HolidayCity and got a fantastic rate: 125 E per night! For this rate, in this neighborhood, Hotel Duminy Vendome is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MikeVA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through go-today which gave us an affordable package for air and hotel from Washington. The hotel was nice and staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean when we arrived and kept tidy by the housekeeping staff, who were also very friendly. Our room faced into the courtyard, and was quiet at night. Not alot of activity on the street-side of the hotel at night, so I don't think anyone had a problem with noise. Breakfast was good enough to get us going - croissants, coffee, toast, yogurt; plenty to keep us fed until lunchtime. Location was perfect - the Tuilleries metro is a block away, so getting to all points was not a problem. The Louvre, Seine, and Ile-de-Cite are an easy walk. Overall, not the most luxurious hotel, but good enough and a great value for the price and location. We never plan on living in the hotel room on any vacation we take anyway!

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: neepon
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for the room months in advance. When I arrived in Paris to check in, they had my booking but did not have a room for me. They sent me blocks away to an inferior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: janinepairserv
Reviews.Content: We arrived on September 8th in the early morning and stayed until the 17th of September. We were greeted by a lovely young lady who secured our luggage for us and informed us the room would be ready by about noon. We searched the hotel brochures and took off to explore Paris! The location on Rue Mont du Thabor is very handy. It was a short walk to Rue de Rivoli and Les Jardins des Tuileries where you can take a bus or metro. It's also a short walk to book a L'Open Tour which we did for the first 2 days of our stay which gave us a very nice overview of what we wanted to see. It's also a short walk to either the Louvre or Musee D'Orsay from here. Paris is a very "walkable city". The public transportation is wonderful. We took the RER to Versailles for a mere 5 Euros roundtrip and it was only a half hour each way! We enjoyed many of the wonderful brasseries and, especially, Angelina's Patisserie on Rue de Rivoli...not to be missed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: mrboo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Duminy Vendome for 6 nights the last week of September 2006 for a postponed honeymoon. Arrived early Sunday morning in Paris and went straight to the hotel. The front desk clerk had a room ready for me and upgraded me to the Privilege room for free. Pretty nice of her! This is a more expensive room and is really big for European standards and was facing the courtyard; very quiet. Of course, all older hotels in Europe have thin walls, so you can sort of hear the next door neighbor's plumbing sometimes or if they talk really loud, but otherwise, I highly recommend getting an inner courtyard room if you want quiet. The rooms are updated and have the regular amenities; air conditioning, coffee pot, steam press, hair dryer, etc. If you want the Ritz Hotel style of living (just 2 blocks around the corner), then this isn't the place for you. If you want a great value, clean comfortable room, and the best location in Paris, then I suggest you book a room at Duminy Vendome. The hotel is situated on a quiet backstreet off of Rue De Rivoli, a main road, nested near the Westin, Renaissance, and other 5 star hotels. If this is your first time in Paris, I highly recommend staying here. The location is absolutely prime! And I mean PRIME! The metro is literally a 2 minute walk away, you can walk to the Louvre in 7 minutes. The only downside is that the restaurants and cafes are all kind of expensive around here because it's in a really nice part of town, so my wife and I either walked to the Opera district for cheaper restaurants (there are no cheap restaurants in Paris) or got on the metro and within 15 minutes we were in the St Germain district. There are two major tour companies just around the corner from Duminy Vendome where you can schedule city tours, Seine river cruises, day trips to Versailles, etc. Again, this is the very best location you can stay at in Paris. This is important because some of the day trips out of Paris leave very early in the morning, so the convenience of having the pickup point just around the block is really nice. I guarantee you will say to yourself...damn, this hotel location is the best and you can either walk or take the metro and be at all the sites within 15 minutes. Of course you'll go see Notre Dame and Sacre Couer, Louvre, and all the regular tourist stuff...but I highly recommend going to Palace of Versailles on a full day trip and pay the extra 9 euros to see the Marie Antoinette hamlet and Petit/Grand Trianon mansions on the outer gardens of Versailles. There is this little country village that Marie Antoinette had constructed for her own amusement and it has a working farm, fish pond, and looks like it came right out of Snow White and the Seven Dwarves. It's really neat! Also, if you are around on a Saturday, take a train out to Vaux Le Vicomte chateaux (about an hour train ride). Smaller than Versailles, but really neat. The story behind this place is that the treasurer of France, Fouquet, built this spectacular mansion in the 17th century and had a big party after completing it and invited King Louis XIV over. King Louis XIV was so impressed and jealous, that he drummed up some fake charges that Fouquet was imbezzling money from France and had him imprisoned immediately, sentenced him to life in prison, stole all the furniture, tapestries, artwork, and then got the architect and gardener who designed Vaux Le Vicomte to go and build himself a grander place...yes...this place was the inspiration for Palace of Versailles. It gets better, Louis supposedly placed an iron mask on Fouquet in prison...and you may have heard this story before because...a French writer named Alexander Dumas used this story to write Man in the Iron Mask and Count of Monte Cristo. Totally awesome place like Versailles! Got to go to both places! The best value restaurant we came across in Paris that a friend of my wife's took us to was in the Opera district. The restaurant serves all dishes related to duck (foie grois, roast duck, etc.) and you can get a dinner for 9 euros, bottle of wine for 6 euros, and the food is really good. It's called Domaine Lintillac, 10 rue Saint-Augustin 75002. In the St. Germaine district (in my opinion, the nicest part of Paris), I recommend Peres Et Filles, 81 Rue de Seine, 75006 paris for good food, little bit more expensive than the other place. And just around the corner from Peres Et Filles, eat at Paul bakery for bread and pastries and Amorino for the best 4 euro gelato on earth. Oh yes, try the coconut gelato, you will thank me. Don't worry about trying to find a good cheap restaurant in Paris; they're all expensive. Like my parents told me before I left, whatever money you are thinking of bringing on the trip, just double it, and they were pretty much right. By far, this was the most expensive place I've ever been to but the city and sights are so beautiful, it's like "c'est la vie!" and just enjoy the good food and parisian life and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaxes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duminy Vendome for 5 days and had a great stay. We expected the rooms to be small, which they were, but the beds were very comfortable and the sheets & towels were changed every day. The rooms were air conditioned and had all tea & coffee making faclities, trouser press, hairdryer, mini bar etc. The staff were really friendly and helpful in recommending eating places etc. Included in the price was an American buffet breakfast which, although the same every day, there was plenty to choose from. This made a good start to the day as eating out wasn't particularly cheap. Our favourite eating place was recommended by a taxi driver and if you like seafood then pay a visit to Brasserie Bofinger on 5-7 Rue de la Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel! We had heard stories of how small all the hotels in Paris are, but we had a king-sized bed and plenty of room. We did upgrade one room class, so this probably helped out with the size, while adding very little to the cost. The main benefit of this hotel is the fantastic location - it is a few blocks from the Louvre and right across the street from the Jardins des Tuileries. We were able to walk to several areas - the Latin Quater, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, to name a few. We also had breakfast included with our room rate, which saved us quite a bit of money. The staff is friendly and speaks English. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an economical and convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at Duminy Vendome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married last summer (Aug. '05) and decided to go to Europe for our honeymoon. We spent the first four days of our trip in Paris. After our travel agent recommended this hotel, we booked it ourselves online. I have to say that the price we paid is very reasonable for a hotel in Paris! After catching a shared ride from the airport to the hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect since my husband had arranged everything. My first impression was that it was a very cute boutique type hotel. It was small but the staff was friendly. We didnt know any French, but that didn't matter. We had no problems checking in. Once we got to our rooms, yes they weren't your typical American size hotel room, but it was big enough for two people and clean! The rooms were also equipped with air condition, a big tub/shower, lots of towels, coffee maker, etc. We didnt mind the size of the room because we didnt spend much time there. The hotel is in such a great location, that we spent all 4 days, exploring the city by foot! There is just so much to do and its all within walking distance from the hotel! As far as the food, we did enjoy breakfast at the hotel every morning since it was included with the room price. There was a variety of food (American and French) and enough to please everyone! As far as lunch and dinner, well we had no problem finding restaurants. There are lots to choose from and many cafes all nearby! Overally, I would say if you are looking for a true "French" experience and location is important to you, stay at Duminy Vendome - you'll enjoy it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice funky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duminy Vendome in 2003. I just discovered this website, so I am trying to put reviews of past hotel stays since I think that this site is great. This is a nice little funky hotel – it seems a bit more like a Parisian apartment building than a hotel per se, which is actually a cool feeling. Breakfast was pretty nice – though funky – eating in basement/cellar and may not be so sunlite but cozy with fellow travelers. We had a room on the top floor and it was a cool little loft-like feel - - with angled ceiling. There was plenty of light. Yes, it was small - - like I said felt like Parisian apartment – but it was cool, cozy, and seemed more interesting stay than at a sterile hotel room that does not change country to country. Location is also very central and very well-located for travelers (including a Metro station very near).

Reviews.Title: “Positively Lacking!”
Reviews.Author: 007travelgal
Reviews.Content: We travel quite often and all over the world. We visited Trip Advisor and seeing that there were mostly positive reviews about the location etc of this hotel, we decided to let our travel agent book for us, as our trip was covering 14 days and several countries. We arrived in Paris to find the receptionist (and I use the term loosely) sitting there talking on the phone. Ignoring us in the way that only the French do so well, we waited. Having made our reservations months before, and confirming them again 2 days prior, we expected no problems. The hotel itself is located in good position. The T. gardens are a quick walk away. There's an Irish pub just down the street and a market about a block away. The hotel lobby is small and crowded, the elevator is quite frankly a joke. You can only fit 2 persons with luggage and it's excrutiatingly slow..Better to take the stairs, however...that being said, taking the stairs is a feat unto itself...Better hold the rails and go slowly.. The "lounge" reminded me of what a house of ill repute might look like....The red color, the fringy lampshades...very tacky and definitely not my cup of tea. Still waiting on reception, we decided to head down the stairs to where the breakfast area was. Definitely not quaint as described by some, but more like the basement with old furniture and tacky wall coverings nailed into the wall to cover up who knows what. Breakfast itself was adequate. There was ample food, so lots of choices, but somehow not an "experience" I would say was enjoyable. It's not as if you'd want to linger other than to eat. Finally! Receptionist deems to help us. Gives our room keys. My husband asks politely....."the children are in adjoining rooms as requested? No..."Are they across the hall?" Very close.....No! 10 doors between us around the corner and their room was right across from the lift. We were absolutely floored to walk in their tiny little room with 1 double bed that was so smoky that you needed a gas mask to survive. It was almost as if someone was standing there smoking...heard us put a key in and promptly slipped out the window.... I went down and basically said that this situation was not acceptable to us....to which she replied...."so sorry." "Nothing to be done."...I asked for a manager...She replied that it wouldn't matter. That was that. THAT ruined our experience there. I would NEVER go back. NO customer service, small rooms, horrible staff. Just not worth the money. There was a Renaissance Suites directly across the street. We went in and NEXT time that is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AvivaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Duminy Vendome hotel in Paris . We enjoyed the spacious room and service . Also, the hotel has a great location - near the Tuileiries gardens, the Louvre and the Place de La Concorde.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xaves99
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel - we did have a newly renovated room which has been done in chocolate colours and seems quite "French". Our room was very big by French standards with 2 casement windows which opened onto a lovely steet vista. I didn't find it noisy and by goodness, its Paris ! I found the front desk staff fine although they are typically reserved. No gushing service but the lass on the desk helped us store our luggage for the day when we were leaving and organised us a taxi. THe only thing that was negative for me is the lift. Its tiny and really only you and your suitcases can fit in. There were 4 people from our group in it one day (no luggage) and it stopped - maybe it was too heavy but it wasn't very nice for them although staff of course ensured there rescue quiet promptly. As for location..excellent. A walk to Place Vendome, the Ritz, the Louvre, glitzy shops, Angelina for hot chocolate to die for (do not miss this) and to Concorde metro. I would stay here again as the price is excellent for what you get in terms of location, room size and room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel; wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was perfect. We stayed 7 nights in a Privilege triple: room 310. The room was very large by European standards, much bigger than our 5 star double in Rome! The bathroom was appointed in marble and quite large, with bath and shower and bidet and 2 sinks. We were a short walk from the Tuileries Gardens and the Metro station. We walked to the Louvre, the D'Orsay, Place Vendome, and Notre Dame. We walked to Eiffel Tower and the Pompidou Centre and Les Halles. The hotel is newly redecorated with some signs of renovation in the hallways, but this was not an issue for us as our room was comfortable and clean and attractive. The staff was friendly and helpful and cooperative. The hotel is on Rue de Mont Thabor, just between the Rue di Rivoli and Rue Ste. Honore. We had 2 large french windows in our room and another large french window in the bathroom, which all opened onto the courtyard. The housekeeping service was excellent and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location -- Good place for first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: msp132
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend Thanksgiving weekend in Paris -- our first trip there -- and needed a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of everything (especially since we were only going to be there for 3 days). The Hotel Duminy Vendome is very central -- right across from Jardin Tuilieres (sp?) -- so we were close enough to everything and on a metro line (when the walking started to poop us out). Our room was your standard European room: High ceilings, thin walls, small space -- but very nice. Bathroom is a little outdated but otherwise clean -- the tub was a bit of a climb to get into though! Toiletries were always restocked and general housekeeping was very good. The room was more than sufficient for the limited time we spent in it. My only advice is try to request a room that doesn't face the street. Although it's not a busy street, you'll hear all the late-night rowdiness through those thin walls/windows -- especially if you're a light sleeper. Front desk staff is helpful to a degree. Don't ask for a wake-up call -- they won't remember. Didn't eat the breakfast in the hotel. It didn't seem worth the $$ when there are plenty of cafes around the corner. General Paris advice/opinions: If you're planning your first trip to Paris and only have a couple of days, my advice is skip the Louvre (you can do that on the next trip -- trust me, you'll come back to Paris) and go to the Musee d'Orsay right across the river from the Jardin Tulieres. Great impressionist works (Monet, Van Gogh, etc.) and not as intimidating as the Louvre for your first trip. The museum is in an old train station -- it's a beautiful building. Also, if you're looking for that postcard-perfect photo of Paris, climb the 300+ steps at Notre Dame to get a breathtaking view of the city -- Eiffel Tower included. Why climb the Eiffel to get a view of Paris? I mean, without the Eiffel Tower in the picture, it's just another photo of another city! The tower is far more interesting (and photo-worthy) from the ground looking up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: Erickrop
Reviews.Content: We just return from Paris and stayed five days at the Duminy Vendome. We were upgraded to a Privilage Room and it was huge, Room No. 609. By far this was the biggest hotel room we ever had in Europe. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was great, the staff was friendly, and the location is one of the best in Paris. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hilltowngal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Duminy-Vendome in mid-November, 2005. We found it to be a clean, mostly quiet place to stay. The location is perfect - near the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and Tuileries Gardens. It is also near designer stores, which are great for window-shopping if you are in our price bracket. A buffet breakfast was included in the package we bought, and is served in the hotel's basement. There was a good variety of food offered. There were also provisions for coffee or tea in our room. The hotel appears to have been recently redecorated, and was plenty warm for cold winter days. The elevator was small, but will just hold four people. We didn't experience noise from the street, but sometimes we heard people in the next room or in the hall. We didn't hear other peoples' TVs or water running. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good, near attractions”
Reviews.Author: checkde
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights for our first trip to Paris. Our fifth floor room was clean; the A/C worked perfectly, and though the room was tiny there was a desk sufficient for getting a little work done. The location was fantastic. We walked almost everywhere and took the subway every where else. We did not use the restaurant, bar, or ask the staff for assistance or advice. We were pleased with our stay. So if you are looking for a decent place to rest each night after a day of sightseeing, we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: allesvoorjouw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nites and loved the location-close to most major attractions and the metro. Clean rooms, well serviced. Nice breakfast from crosoints to eggs and sausage. Would recommend a room at the back side of the hotel if you like to sleep with windows open--Paris gets up early and can be noisy at the front of the hotel. Elevators were surprisingly small, but there are two of them. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: karlagathon
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a seven night stay at the Duminy Vendome. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. One young guy (who was always smiling and engaging) even gave me his e-mail address in case I had questions regarding my next visit (scheduled for February). The maids were friendly and thorough. My room was clean, although it could use a little updating. For example, the bedspread had a small stain and was pilled. Some scuffs on the walls. The walls were thin, but it's Europe. I heard none of the water noises reported by some people. The room was average size (small), but it wasn't laid out very well, and didn't feel exactly comfortable. The location is PHENOMENAL. Just across the street from the Tuileries Garden and Metro stop (which is well connected with the other lines). Moments away from the Louvre, Angelinas (best hot chocolate ever), Place Vendome and Rue St. Honore (great high end shopping), Place de la Concorde. Beautiful, safe location; plenty of restaurants and cafes open late. Quiet in the evenings. I would stay here again if I wanted to be in this location. By the way, I discovered that the package I bought through an internet website (beginning with [--]) was grossly overpriced compared to what I would have paid if I had only called the hotel. Oh well, live and learn. Finally, I have only had positive interactions with the French people. I am more and more convinced that we get what we give, and that sometimes we are not aware of what we are putting out into the world. Pick up "French or Foe" by Polly Platt; learn to ask simply for what you need in French. I have had many wonderful interactions with Parisians who have gone the extra mile to help me or just to connect with me, just by showing an interest in their language and their social cues. I can't wait to go back. Hidden Treasure: Musee Jacquemart-Andre.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the fall...ooh la la”
Reviews.Author: JulieNitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 days in Paris from September 20th to the 28th. The Duminy Vendome was a clean, comfortable, quiet hotel that did what we needed it to do. As other reviewers stated, the location is perfect. You are in the middle of wherever you want to go. The metro stop (Toulleries) is moments away. The hotel is a small 5 story hotel tucked away on a small side street behind Rue de Rivoli. The elevator is tiny; 3 people maximum. Had to take 2 trips with the luggage. No big deal though. We never ate breakfast in the hotel...there are patisseries and fruit stands on Rue St. Honore (1 block away) and each morning we tried all sorts of things...baguettes, cheese, yogurt, fruit and croissants. All wonderful and cheaper than the hotel breakfast. We stayed on the 4th floor, the a/c was fine, and the room did what we wanted it to do. It had enough space, but very little furniture to unpack our things. My husband hung his things up, I lived out of my suitcase. The bathroom was marble, had a bathtub with a shower curtain and was clean. The only true negative that impacted us was the front desk staff. We called and asked them how to use the Metro to get to the hotel from the airport. They gave us the wrong stop off of the RER and we couldn't transfer to the Metro. It caused us some distress, but we worked it out. The staff are not concierges, they are young kids. We asked about a tour about the Opera Garnier and the answer was "I don't know". I would have expected more. That being said, if you are looking for a central location, with decent amenities this hotel will do quite nicely. If you need a lot of help with your sightseeing, pick another place with better services. Most of all, relax, have fun, eat delicious things and enjoy your time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnriser
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about this hotel as had seen very different reviews. But we where very pleased when we got there. Myself and my husband travelled with our 12 year old son, so picking a safe and suitable hotel / area was important. The hotel is small but our triple room was the largest room we have ever had in Paris. The bathroom was very big. There where a few marks on the walls etc... which could have been dealt with but in general the room was clean and comfortable. the location is Fantastic, just a stones through from the Louvre and very close to more restaurants than you could ever want. A warning about restaurants STAY AWAY from the chinese across the road from the hotel!!!!!! food is good when it eventually comes, they have coach loads of chinese tourists who ALL get served first...... also they botched our order, and ignored us when we mentioned it!!! Great shop for shoes around the corner!!! LES BELLES AFFAIRES. Be careful on checkout, they where charging us €90 for breakfast which we didn't have. but had no problem when brought to their attention. oh one other thing.... windows have VERY small guards which a small child could easily climb, so ask for a lower floor if staying with children. Would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Travellerholic
Reviews.Content: As the fifth destination on our seven-country, seven week adventure, Paris was a city we eagerly anticipated. The so-called double room in the Hotel Vendome was an unfunny joke. Scarcely big enough to accommodate one person, let alone two, we had no space for our suitcases, nor any drawers into which we might unpack. Walls made of cardboard - dirty bathroom - smoke-smelling bedclothes. Yuck! After advising the staff that we wished to check out and find another hotel they managed to find us a bigger room, a so-called 'Privelege Room', for which we had to pay an extra 40 Euros. The front desk is staffed by indifferent juveniles, whilst the invisible manager hides in his office, unavailable to assist the several irate guests who had various issues... JE SUIS DESOLE, DUMINY VENDOME. NEVER AGAIN! PS WE ARE SMALL PEOPLE, 126 AND 150 POUNDS, SO I CAN'T IMAGINE HOW BIGGER PEOPLE WOULD COPE WITH THE SPACE RESTRICTIONS. WE HAVE TRAVELLED EXTENSIVELY AND UNDERSTAND THAT EUROPEAN HOTEL ROOMS ARE OFTEN SMALLER THAN WE ARE USED TO.

HotelInfo.Name: Duminy Vendome
HotelInfo.Address: 3 / 5, rue du Mont Thabor | 1st Arr., 75001 Paris, France
